terms.name: contact affiliation
terms.value: Key Laboratory of Zoonosis, Ministry of Education, College of Veterinary Medicine, Jilin University, P. R. China

description: Porcine pleuropneumonia caused by Actinobacilluspleuropneumoniae (APP) is a swine respiratory disease with an important impact around the world either as a single infection or part of the porcine respiratory disease complex. The data of interaction between hosts and pathogens has becoming more crucial for exploration of the mechanism. However, up to now, comparatively little information is available on the systemic and dynamic changes that occur in pig serum in response to APP infection.  This study used iTRAQ to identify differentially expressed proteins (DEPs) in pig serum in response to APP infection.

modifications.name: No PTMs are included in the dataset

terms.name: Reference
terms.value: Zhu R, Bao C, Liu B, Xiao J, Sun C, Feng X, Langford PR, Li Y, Lei L. iTRAQ-based quantitative proteomic analysis of peripheral blood serum in piglets infected with Actinobacillus pleuropneumoniae. AMB Express. 2020 10(1):121

title: APP infected and healthy Pig serum LC-MSMS
